rules.ruleString: Unit was previously coded {EC203, EC2031, EC2034, EC212, EC238, ECC2010%, ECC9010%, ECO2010%, ECO2030%, ECO4620}
Must have passed 1 (I/W) units in {ECC1100} with grades other than {STANDARD-DEF, STANDARD-NS}
Incompatible with achievement in (I/W) {ECC5901, ECC9010, ECX9010, ETC2110}

description: Keynesian macroeconomics; the open-economy, IS-LM framework and the aggregate demand-aggregate supply framework as a basis for more advanced macroeconomic analysis; principles of monetary and fiscal policy and problems of implementation; alternative theories of aggregate supply; new classical macroeconomics and the implications of imperfect information; new Keynesian macroeconomics and the implications of labour market rigidities; explaining and correcting inflation and unemployment.
